results.title: On the highway
results.brief_description: Long distance driving on highways needs extra care. David Mackay, a prominent racing driver explains techniques and adds a few tips of his own. Begins with images of the Southern Aurora train as it speeds through the countryside approaching Sydney.

results.title: On the edge of the forest
results.brief_description: Dr E F Schumacher the noted author of the book ‘Small is Beautiful’, describes in clear, elegant and incisive English what man is doing to the forests of southwest Western Australia. Stresses the need for conservation of the Jarrah and Karri forests in order to preserve the unique natural eco-system.

results.title: On the critical path
results.brief_description: Nuclear power plants are not exactly sold on the same scale as wheat, but that they can be manufactured as an exportable commodity is well illustrated in this film. For those familiar with nuclear power generation, and even for the lay audience, this is a lucid exposition of how a nuclear power plant is put together. The film shows the machining and assembly of principal components, and the “on power” operation of the Canadian plant at Pickering, Ontario.

results.title: On the buses
results.creator_credit: Hammer Film Productions, Ronald Wolfe, Ronald Chesney and Harry Booth
results.brief_description: Based on the successful British comedy television series this feature film version of “On the buses” continues in the same vein with its bawdy humour, one-liners, lecherous males and well-endowed young females (mini-skirts and all). The story line is a bit thin and outdated, but all the familiar characters are still on board (pardon the pun). Bus driver Stan (Reg Varney) and his conductor Jack (Bob Grant) are rather annoyed when Inspector Blakey (Stephen Lewis) decides to put on extra bus drivers. To make matters worse however, the new drivers are not only going to stop Stan from making a bit of extra from working overtime but are female. Prepare yourself for sexist jokes and the stereotypical “butch” women drivers. Stan and Jack’s immediate reaction is to try and sabotage the whole show. However, Inspector Blakey retaliates, and ends up with the last laugh - or does he? Cast also includes Doris Hare, Michael Robbins, Anna Karen.

results.title: On the Bowery
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary tells about life in New York’s Bowery, the haunt of alcoholics and derelicts. No attempt is made to sensationalise; it is simply an objective, but at the same time stark and moving, account of men who have passed the point of no return and live in a half-world of cheap drink, argument, theft, card-playing and bread and soup from the local mission.

results.title: On the border of life: glimpses of French biological research
results.creator_credit: Triangle Productions, Jacqueline Jacoupy, Nicole Vedres and Jean Rostand
results.brief_description: Opens with brief introductions to biology, and then surveys the work of leading French laboratories. The ground covered includes experiments in artificial parthenogenesis, sex determination, suspended animation and research into the secrets of immortality. Commentary by John Barry.

results.title: On the Black Hill
results.creator_credit: BFI, Jennifer Howarth and Andrew Grieve
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bruce Chatwin, this is an unrelenting portrayal of the raw experience of rural farm life in the Welsh border country. Starting in 1895, it focuses on the lives of four generations of a farming community and spans 85 years. At the heart of the story is the intense relationship between identical twin brothers, Benjamin (Mike Gwilym) and Lewis (Robert Gwilym) Jones. The film ultimately expresses the healing nature of time and the promise of the future.

results.title: On the Birdsville Track
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Jack Absalom’s outback Australia series”.
The most infamous bush track runs for 540 kilometres through Australia’s centre. Its history is one of personal hardships and tough pioneering people. Once goods were carried to remote cattle properties by camel and only in recent times was a road made across the sand dunes. Jack Absalom recalls the old times, meets newcomers to “The Birdsville Track” and has some sound travel advice. Rated: G

results.title: On the Beach
results.creator_credit: Lomitas Productions, United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.brief_description: On the Beach is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lomitas Productions, United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.description: ‘On the Beach’ is one of the most celebrated anti-nuclear films in motion picture history. Based on the novel by Nevil Shute, it is the story of US Naval commander Dwight Towers, who is sent to assist Australian authorities after the rest of the world has been devastated by a nuclear holocaust. Towers must attempt to save a small group of survivors as impending doom approaches.

Towers must attempt to save a small group of survivors as impending doom approaches.
